ratings.comment: Testing was the biggest struggle for me. Even when I would study and give it my all my tests scores were bad. You might think your right on a question but it was like the 2nd best answer. Never was able to understand her thinking process and what she would think is the right answer. Lectures are interesting though.

Psych 460 was a really great class to take, especially for aspiring psych majors. She teaches the class with a clear outline and is receptive to in-lecture questions and answers them in the moment. Attending lecture is very helpful and even missing one or two wasn't the end of the world. She understands the topic extremely well def recommend it.

This course had a significant emphasis on textbook readings and lecture material. If you read the textbook and take notes during each lecture, the exams should not be too difficult. Many of the topics are related to each other so studying is crucial. Overall, I enjoyed this course. Dr. Rissman seemed very passionate about this field.

Professor Rissman (Dr.Rizz) is objectively brilliant- she knows her stuff and lectures are heavy but intriguing so I liked her. Her exams are hard and its hard to grasp what to know for them. For a 3 credit class she expects a LOT from her students and it can be unreasonable. Doesn't believe in curves so get ready to WORK if you want a good grade.

A QUEEN! She put up with NO BS in this class, and called out disrespectful individuals more than once!  You can tell she cares about this topic and is very smart. She is quite sarcastic and has a dry sense of humor, but she's the best. People who are complaining about her probably do badly on the exams, and blame her for it. WE LOVE DR. RISSMAN!

Course content was interesting, very lecture heavy. Slides posted on canvas but definitely still attend every lecture if possible. Very vague multiple choice exams. 3 midterms, one paper, and several small extra credit assignments. Class is okay if you are study hard and are good at multiple choice exams

Pretty average professor. I didn't have problems with her, but nothing spectacular. Very lecture heavy class, slides are posted to canvas but recordings aren't, you can piece most of it together if you miss class. LOTS of specific studies to know, tests are hard but definitely manageable if you pay attention in class. Small extra credit projects.

She's a really tough grader and her exams are extremely hard! She also doesn't round up grades even if you are like .1% away. Her lectures were interesting and good but I wouldn't recommend her because of her overly vague exams and tough grading.

Professor Rissman's lectures were very dense but overall engaging and interesting. She heavily relies on research studies in her lectures and exams. Attendance isn't required, but she gives most of the research information during lecture so would highly recommend attending. Test wording is very confusing, but doable. There are 3 midterms & 1 paper.

Engaging lectures and information is interesting. Class is exam heavy but she gives a decent amount of extra credit. Doesn't offer many office hours or support outside of class. Reading the textbook is helpful, but most information on exams is covered in lecture.
She is a good professor but her exams can sometimes be hard. Making sure to read the textbook is very important (I did not and maybe if I would've that would've helped me a lot).

Exams are so hard and there are not that many assignments that make up your grade so if you bomb the first exam it's real hard to climb your way back up. Gives a lot of extra credit for super little points so it doesn't really help. If you take this class you have to actually work super hard.

Dr. Rissman is an outstanding professor who brings years of experience and seasoned wisdom to her teaching of this course. Her lectures were engaging, interactive and really emphasized active learning. She is always willing to help students succeed. Her exams are hard but if you study hard and put in the effort, you'll do good. We love Lilia.

Rissman was an alright professor. She's knowledgeable in child development and answers questions clearly. The class itself is fine with tests, an essay, and some observation homework which is cool. I don't really have a strong opinion against or for the class.

Eh, could be worse. Very nice that attendance is mandatory. Got bored of her lectures. Monotone voice, not super passionate. Exams are tough, you gotta read the book. Decent extra credit tho. She cancelled so many classes cause she was apparently sick. If you don't have to take this class, find an easier one.
Easy to do well if you take good notes and attend lectures

Don't take this class - it's a waste of time. Not accessible outside of class, very specific exams, vague study guides - she does this on purpose to see if you understand. Not a lot of homework, but there is a large paper due once. I personally really disliked her.  If you want to do well read the textbook thoroughly -otherwise don't take it.

Dr. Rissman was great. She presented the content in a meaningful way and facilitated discussion in the classroom. There are three exams, many short discussion post assignments, and a final paper. She offers a lot of extra credit assignments, so be sure to do all of them. You NEED to read the textbook thoroughly and attend all classes to do well.

At first I didn't like her because she gave really vague lectures about broad topics but had incredibly detailed exams. After receiving feedback on the first exam however she changed her approach and provided us with study guides. My grade drastically improved after she made the change and I started to appreciate her more.

I liked Professor Rissman, she is very nice and passionate about her work. The semester started out rough with a hard exam but after feedback she changed her techniques a bit and the next exam was much better. She is not really available outside of class besides her office hours or after class for a little, so I recommend going to her OH for help

I don't know why she's getting bad reviews. Honestly my favorite professor so far at UW. She is very passionate and knowledgeable about the topic. I loved that she would engage the class in lectures, she would often go around and ask questions to the class. At times, lecture felt more like a Socratic seminar which I loved. Lectures were engaging

Professor Rissman did a very good job at answering any questions and facilitating discussions during lecture. She held review sessions before each exam where she basically answered any questions we had which I found helpful and prepared us for the exams. She also provided us with plenty of extra credit that really boosted our final grades.

Professor Rissman is a really nice person who seems passionate about what she is teaching, however, she is not a good prof. Her lecture slides are horrible (vague) which she doesn't give to you anyway. She never announces when things are due, everything is horribly organized, and she is totally unclear on what concepts are being tested.

Lectures covers topics very broadly but the exam questions can get very specific. Must do the readings to do well on any of the exams. Extra Credit was a huge help at the end (very important to do). 3 exams and 1 final paper. Lectures were very underwhelming and she didn't post the lecture slides. Yet, many people stopped going anyway.

I wasn't a big fan of her lectures, but she was a good professor. You have 3 exams, and one big paper. She also gives opportunities for extra credit which boost my grade. I got a BC on the first two exam, and a A on the paper and last exam, and still got a A with the extra credit. Her exams are hard and no lecture slides are posted.

For such an interesting class, it's a pity that Lilia makes it so difficult to succeed. Test questions are vague and the lecture slides aren't available outside of class. Your grade is based solely on 3 major tests and 1 paper, which means you MUST do well on every test. She assigns extra credit which gives you a boost, but it can only do so much.
Definitely need to put the work in and do all of the reading, but the class is super interesting and its worth it

She was a good professor and the lectures were very interesting but there were only three tests and a paper that counted towards your grade and the tests would be on material covered from lecture. It was a fine class just a lot of reading in the textbook and she did not make her slides accessible to students so it was hard to learn.

I thought Rissman was a good lecturer and brought up really cool studies around key concepts. It's unfortunate that such an interesting class was so hard to succeed in because your grade is solely dependent upon three exams. No matter how well you knew the material the questions had multiple correct answers and didn't test you on basic concepts.

I enjoyed Psych 460. I learned many things and feel she explains topics thoroughly, but the textbook readings were a bit much. I know I'm a slow reader, but I would spend HOURS reading the textbook each week. I eventually gave up with them. Your grade is based off of the exams and final paper. Nothing else affects it that much. Good extra credit!

Lectures are all over the place with no direction or clear takeaways. Lecture slides are not regularly available. Study guides for exams were very vague. Also seem to be nonresponsive to critique. When a lot of students get an exam question wrong she still maintains it is a good question. Paper worth 24% of grade is do five days before last exam.

I'm a psych major and have taken two classes similar to child development in the past but this was by far the hardest class for absolutely no reason. Her tests were so hard and half the time didn't even make sense.

The exams were extremely hard because lectures were so vague. You have to do most of the learning outside the class using the textbook and other materials. She hardly gives you any information in class and gives hardly any help for the exams. One of the hardest classes I've had to take in this department when it shouldn't have been.

I was excited to take this course as I was interested in the topic, however after this semester I plan to never take another course similar to this. The class is unnecessarily difficult due to a lack to clear understanding of what will be on the exam. Lectures are boring and the textbook is so dense and uninteresting.
